title: VA Health Care
description: The VA provides comprehensive medical care to eligible veterans through VA hospitals and clinics nationwide. Services include preventative care, outpatient services, hospital care, medications, and mental health services.
eligibility: Must have served in the active military, naval, or air service
Must have been discharged under other than dishonorable conditions
Minimum duty requirements may apply depending on when you served

application.instructions: Complete VA Form 10-10EZ online or at your local VA medical center. You can also call 1-877-222-VETS (8387) for assistance.

underutilizedReason: Many Veterans are unaware they qualify for VA health care benefits, even without service-connected disabilities.

title: VA Disability Compensation
description: Tax-free monthly payment for veterans with disabilities that are the result of a disease or injury incurred or aggravated during active military service. The benefit amount depends on your assigned disability rating (0%-100%) and number of dependents.
eligibility: Have a current physical or mental disability
Have an injury or disease that began during active duty or was made worse by active military service
Have a disability that is connected to your military service
Discharge status must not be dishonorable

application.instructions: File a claim online through VA.gov, by mail using VA Form 21-526EZ, in person at a VA regional office, or with the help of a trained Veterans Service Officer (VSO).

title: Post-9/11 GI Bill
description: The Post-9/11 GI Bill provides financial support for education and housing to individuals with at least 90 days of aggregate service after September 10, 2001, or individuals discharged with a service-connected disability after 30 days.
eligibility: Served at least 90 days of active duty service after Sept. 10, 2001
Different benefit levels based on length of service

application.instructions: Apply online through VA.gov or by submitting VA Form 22-1990.
